data.title: Using a sonicwall to route web addresses between sites
data.meta_description:
Hi All 
I have a strange request, i look after a site with active directory sonicwall basically a normal network, i have a DNS entry to route to our parent companys intranet page and it works fine, we also have other sit…
data.text:
Hi All

I have a strange request, i look after a site with active directory sonicwall basically a normal network, i have a DNS entry to route to our parent companys intranet page and it works fine, we also have other sites around europe already connecting to us through sonicwall VPN and rather than setting up their systems seperatly we want to have them securely go to the webpage routed through us. having trouble with the settings though any ideas?

ps 1 plant in scotland does not ahve DNS installed on their AD (dont ask why we didnt set it up) so they wouldnt be able to connect normalyl anyway this would be our best option

Many thanks

Hi Arnie, I’m afraid I’m pretty vague on what you are asking for.

So you have a parent company with a web page. All of your branches (which sounds like you’re one too? You’re not at parent company) have SonicWall site-to-site VPN’s.

You want everyone in the company to type in a web URL and go to the parent companies web page?

It sounds like you have Active Directory, is that at every site?
